hint.text:
The square of a number \('x'\) is \(x^2\)
Square root of \(x^2\) can be written as \(\sqrt{x^2}=x\)

solution.text:
\(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*l}}_=_{j}_^_{m}_ \times _{k}_^_{n}_ \times _{l}_ \)
Dividing the number by \(_{l}_\), the quotient (which is a square number) obtained is \(\frac{_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*l}}_}{_{l}_}=_{{(j**m)*(k**n)}}_\).
The quotient can be written as :
\(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)}}_=_{j}_^_{m}_ \times _{k}_^_{n}_ \)
Square root of the quotient \(=\sqrt{_{{(j**m)*(k**n)}}_}\)
\(=\sqrt{_{j}_^_{m}_ \times _{k}_^_{n}_}=_{{(j**(m/2))*(k**(n/2))}}_\)

content.text: What is the square root of the quotient?
